page.title: 02Armed Forces Chaldon Hills
page.content: The Army at West Lulworth has a floating population of about two hundred families for whom seventy one married quarters are provided.One hundred civilians as well as Army Personnel are employed at the camp.There is a Naafi Shop and a Cinema operating once every week on the site,but the Medical Centre on site is for Army personnel only,their families travel to the village of West Lulworth to see the local practioner. For sport there is a Gymnasium and Squash courts as well as a multi-purpose sports track. Eleven hundred students pass through the gunnery school each year,on courses which range from 6-16 weeks.Two hundred permanent staff are employed at the school.Some of the land in the camp area is used in a limited way as a firing range.
